questions.question_text: Which command denies the default route?

discussion.content: A. ip prefix-list deny-route seq 5 deny 0.0.0.0/0

choices.D: ip prefix-list deny-route seq 5 deny 0.0.0.0/8 A

discussion.content: Definitely A, the FIB is the layer 3 forwarding table, and the adjacency table is the layer 2

May be, B.

"This separation of the reachability information (in the Cisco Express Forwarding table) and the forwarding information (in the adjacency table), provides a number of benefits"

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/ipswitch_cef/configuration/15-mt/isw-cef-15-mt-book/isw-cef-overview.html

questions.question_text: Which Cisco Express Forwarding component(s) contain forwarding information?
Which security level is supported throughout all SNMP versions?

choices.E: CHAP uses a challenge string from the server to the client.
choices.C: CHAP requires the client to supply a username and optional password.
choices.A: PAP uses a challenge string from the server to the client.
choices.D: PAP requires the client to supply a username and optional password.
choices.B: PAP can query a TACACS+ server to verify access credentials.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about PAP and CHAP authentication are true? (Choose two)

discussion.content:
Yes, B E
About TACACS+ and PAP:
"Link is encrypted—The data payload of IP packets (TCP packets) is encrypted for security and is stored in encrypted form in the remote security database.

—Supports PAP, CHAP, and MS-CHAP authentication
—Useful for both LAN and WAN security"

http://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=170744&seqNum=4

questions.question_text: Which two statements about the enable secret and enable password commands are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
I think, A C

"If neither the enable password command nor the enable secret command is configured, and if there is a line password configured for the console, the console line password will serve as the enable password for all VTY (Telnet and Secure Shell [SSH]) sessions."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/security/d1/sec-d1-xe-3se-5700-cr-book/sec-d1-xe-3se-5700-cr-book_chapter_010.pdf

choices.E: The enable password command has a stronger encryption algorithm than enable secret. BC
choices.A: If both commands are missing from the global configuration, vty lines use the console password.
choices.B: The enable secret and enable password command overrides enable password.
choices.D: The enable secret command is backwards-compatible with more versions of IOS.
choices.C: The enable secret command overrides enable password.
